Reviews.Title: “Great location for touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: Great location just around the corner form the Pantheon ( which is a marvel). We walked to all the site for our central base. Rooms were clean and adequate, but could do with a few more mod cons. Rooms are big enough, but can be very noise especailly if you are on the 2nd floor ( with the breakfast room & Reception)...ask for a room on the 3rd floor. The breakfast was good, but as we stayed over easter it was very crowded at breakfast time with families queuing to get in at peak time. The room under the breakfast room 124 is very noise early in the morning. It would have been very difficult to find, but we got the hotel taxi to pick us up from the airport 60 Euros for family of 4 ( good value).. Taxi driver got us into the hotel with no problem. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Recommend it for a famly break holiday. Best Coffee shop in Rome just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Bohemian treasure”
Reviews.Author: repermann
Reviews.Content: Right next to Phanteon, in the heart of the heart of Rome! Historical building, also taken care of when it comes to the interior space. Fantastic service all the way! Fresh and tasty breakfast! Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Would absolutely stay here again and recommend this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry M
Reviews.Content: Our Stay was April 19-24 2012. This was my third trip to Rome but my first time staying in the ancient city. The Pantheon was just around the corner from the Pantheon Inn! The hotel itself is a mix of hotel rooms and residentially occupied apartments. I thought this added to the experience of living as close to a local as possible without staying with a family. First of all the hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful. The front desk answered and anticipated all my questions, and were very always warm and friendly. They even provided an easy to follow map of the area. The houskeeper was always happy and pleasant and kept our room well with clean towels and toiletries. The staff kept the breakfast area clean and well stocked at all times. She even assisted in getting the three of us to sit at a table together when it didn't appear to have one available. The breakfast area provided standard breakfast buffet items; croissants, rolls, danishes, doughnuts, meats and cheese, milk cereal, yoghurts, fresh fruit, fruit cocktail, a machine with coffee, cappucino, macchiato, fruit juice, hot chocolate and tea. We never left hungry or disappointed. The rooms were clean, and room decore was nice, not sparse nor too overdone. Lighting was ample, and an in-room fridge was provided, stocked with items to purchase. The King sized bed was comfortable and the bed linens were adequate. The pillows were a little on the flat side for my taste, but having stayed in Italy before, this seems to be standard. Our 9 year old had her own roll away bed and she seemed happy about it, and comfortable. The in-room complimentary Internet was handy, but not functioning for only one of the days we were there. The flat screen television was digital, and had very poor spotty reception. Of course only one channel had English, but the poor TV reception didn't impact our stay in the least. Our one window faced the church in the Piazza Minerva. We listened to the church bells from our room, which really added to the atmpsphere and the rooftop views. Late at night only if the window was open you could hear some street noise (late night partiers). Nothing terribly inconveinient though. Check out the interior of this church... We were so surprised when we finally walked inside!! Staying at the Pantheon Inn, we were within walking distance to all the piazzas and historical sites. We walked to Piazza Navona, The Trevi Fountain, the Coloseum, the Forums, The Vatican and the Spanish Steps. The only transportation we used was expertly and graciously arranged by the hotel staff for a private shuttle to and from the airport. It was the most hassle free way to travel for two adults and a 9 year old who don't speak any Italian. We can't say enough great things about our stay at the Panethon Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location once you can find it”
Reviews.Author: Ken H
Reviews.Content: We loved the clean rooms and friendly staff, but the best feature was its location. We stayed for five days and walked everywhere. We didn't need to use a taxi, bus or metro even once. The tricky part is learning how to get in the first time. Look for the big green door, then look for the buzzer on the left of the door marked Pantheon Inn. Press the buzzer and the staff will release the electronic lock so you can push the massive green door (the left one) open. Then take the stairs up three flights to get to the lobby of the hotel. The building is apparently also used for a few offices, and has a courtyard that looks like it belongs to a private home. There is a tiny elevator available about four steps up the stairs, and you have to select floor 2 to get to the hotel lobby. There are no signs to explain any of this to newcomers, so it feels a little like we joined a secret society to have the privilege to stay at the Pantheon Inn, but - trust me - it was worth it. We hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Boyle1
Reviews.Content: Once you have actually found this little gem of a hotel you will realise what tremendous value it is and just how superb the location ( 75 yards from the Pantheon itself). Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking to sites....”
Reviews.Author: megan c
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Pantheon Inn for Spring Break with my 2 college age sons. (triple room, right off the lobby, a little noisy, but tolerable) They appreciated the free wifi in our room. The beds were comfortable---the bathroom small, but serviceable. The staff was friendly, and the breakfast was adequate. Was surprised to be awoken by seagulls that apparently have taken residence in the courtyard. Loved being able to walk to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navonne. As noted, no big sign for the hotel---must look for key pad, and press a button to gain admittance.(by huge green door) Elevator is small (up three steps and to the right) but worked great, especially appreciated after a long and tiring day. Gelato and snack shop on the same street as the hotel. The local 116 electric bus goes right by the hotel. We took it to the Metro at Piazza Barberini, and then the Metro to San Giovanni to catch the bus to the Catacombs, all ithout a hitch. Would recommend this hotel to friends for location and amenities. Also, as had 6:30 am flight home, arranged for driver both to and from the hotel. A worthwhile splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Exelent”
Reviews.Author: MalinMD
Reviews.Content: Good price! Nice rooms, good cleaning and weary nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany M
Reviews.Content: The location of the Pantheon Inn really could not be beat. The hotel room was very clean and orderly. Everything was pretty perfect until the day before we left. They were doing construction on the room next to ours and they had opened the door to our room, I guess thinking that we wouldn't be back for awhile. It was shocking to find that our door was wide open with all of our things in plain view. They immediately cleaned the wood chips off the floor and closed the door, but then had to reopen the door for some more work. The noise was unbearable so we weren't able to take the nap we had hoped for. This was disappointing. Our room was also right below the kitchen area so we could hear people walking up and down the stairs pretty clearly. Sometimes we could smell the public toilet when walking into the hotel. Breakfast was provided but the meat options and juices were not tasty. Croissants were good. I would recommend staying here but just be aware of a few things that might throw you off. I'm sure the construction will be completed by now though and that was probably our biggest issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brittany W
Reviews.Content: The Inn was great! We stayed for 3 nights while in Rome. The staff was helpful with all questions and replied to all my e-mails very quickly. The room, although slightly older, was large and clean. The bathroom was also a nice size, especially for a European bathroom. The shower was a little small in comparison to an American shower but was adequate. The hotel also arranged for airport pickup and transportation back to the airport. The breakfast was very good, the doughnuts were some of the best we've ever had! The location was awesome and you can literally walk to anything you want to see. The only negative is that you would probably walk by the hotel if you don't google it first. The sign is very little and it is just a huge green door, once you get inside the courtyard there is no sign saying what floor the hotel is on and I actual rang a residents doorbell by accident. The hotel is up 3 flights of stairs, we drug our luggage up but there is a SMALL elevator you can use. All in all we had a great stay and would use this hotel again, you just can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Pantheon Inn - Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the Pantheon, hence the hotel name. Staff is very friendly. Service was very good. Breakfast is very good. We got the room right below the breakfast area and since the place is very old, we heard lot of noise of people walking in the morning. So when we told the staff, they asked us if we wanted to move to another room but we decided to stay in the same room but that was very nice. I would highly recommend this place if you want a center location and don't want to pay too much. Just an FYI, we had to pay City tax in cash even though Hotel.com charged us Taxes and fees but I think this is very common in Eurpoe.

Reviews.Title: “Best location & Best Price!”
Reviews.Author: Joni85383
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay and the Pantheon Inn. If you want to be able to walk all the great sites then this is the place for you. We would rather stay at a small boutique hotel in the center of it all than a 4 or 5 star that is filled with American groups. We travel to experience the culture of the places we go and this hotel is perfect to feel like you're a local. The staff was absolutely AMAZING! We will stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Adi A
Reviews.Content: We stayed last summer there and we were very impressed by the staff and the attention of details. Also the location is great, minutes away from all major historical objectives.

Reviews.Title: “faultless”
Reviews.Author: RJDH
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 4 times now and will be back again for sure! The Pantheon Inn is a real gem of a small hotel, full of atmosphere and attention to detail - from the furnishings to the excellent breakfast that caters for all tastes - everything spotlessly clean, staff very helpful and friendly, fantastic historic central location and good prices.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: joanna m
Reviews.Content: Very charming hotel in the very centre of Rome, just behind Pantheon. I will recommend Pantheon inn to friends and others. The location was fantastic as we could walk to everything. The staff was very nice and friendly. Thank you and bye bye

Reviews.Title: “happy”
Reviews.Author: Sabatino c
Reviews.Content: beautifull place in the heart of Rome, great price and excellent hospitality are the main features of the PANTHEON INN, an excellent reference point to visit Rome with ease. the hotel has wi-fi on the reception level, the staff is friendly, good value for money. Hotel is recommended for its strategic location in the heart of Rome in an area full of bars and things to do ..... BACK SOON....bye!!

Reviews.Title: “Good athmosphere in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Synne L
Reviews.Content: Very charming hotel in the very centre of Rome, just behind Pantheon. The staff was very nice and friendly. I would like to stay here another time in Rome and will recommend the hotel to friends and others. From this hotel your can walk to most of the sites in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location great price”
Reviews.Author: CONSUMER6
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the airport we decided to take the bus to the termini train station (8 euro per person).once at the train station we couldn’t find anyone who was really helpful so we decided to take a cab. The ride was short but the extra turns the taxi took racked up a 17 euro fare. Cab drivers know that majority of tourist with bags are tired and wont out up much of a fight. The hotel receptionist told us that we should have only paid 10 to 11 euro but we weren’t ripped off that bad. Pantheon inn is located on the second floor of the building. I need to inform you of this because when we arrived the ground floor of the building had no signs and no one to greet us. When we did reach the front desk the receptionist spoke English well and was very helpful, he even let us use the printer. The room was small but nice comfortable and clean. Do beware stepping out of the shower as it was a 12 inch step from the shower to the floor. WIFI was unstable but breakfast was well enough. Do bring a travel iron as the hotel does not provide one. And same as others have stated almost all great tourist locations in Rome within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic hospitality”
Reviews.Author: S C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room which accomodated 3 adults and two children. If you plan to spend all of your day site seeing and all you need is a good bed, warm clean shower, and a generous continental breakfast to the start the day then consider the Pantheon Inn. All the staff were very helpful, friendly & spoke english very well. Right next to the Pantheon we found ourselves in the middle of rome, walking distance to all the main sites - trevi fountain, colesseum, spanish steps, Tip if you arrive via Roma Termini (train) take the bus 64, it will cost you 1 E. And it's a very short walk from the bus stop. Watch out for the big green door, you must buzz to gain access inside. A few doors down from the Panthoen Inn you will find the most decident gelati shop, The flavours and textures were amazing, while the service assistant encouraged us to try almost every flavour before we made our final choice. It's not the Hyatt, but definately has the charm and a rustic feel that compliments this extraordinary city, Rome !

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suzenew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights during our trip to Rome. The location was fantastic as we could walk to everything and loved just being able to stroll to the Pantheon. The staff was helpful and friendly, the room was comfortable, and the breakfast was quite nice. We were quite pleased with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: divindaze
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit of a disappointment. Its not your typical hotel. They share a building with other businesses so its a bit tricky to find. You see a big door outside, they buzz you in then you have to go up the stairs searching for the lobby which isn't really a lobby just a check in area. We booked a suite which was one large room with a king bed and a pull out sofa. The room did have character and an "old" feel to it with antiques, painted ceilings and shutters on the windows. The floors looked like they need a good cleaning as well as the bedspreads. I asked for blankets so that I could take off the dirty bedspreads and was told they didn't have extra blankets which I was shocked about. So we slept with just sheets. The hotel was quiet even in a busy area near the Pantheon. The staff was friendly. The breakfast wasn't great. They have canned fruit which I won't eat. Woudl be better off offering fresh fruit and the coffee was horrible tasted instant. The other party we were with didn't have hot water in their room for one full day. They wouldn't switch them to another room but did offer then a room they could go and take showers in which was not very convenient. We didn't have trouble with the hot water in our room though. Not sure if I would return to this hotel but did like the location.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation for three rooms, only had two first night...”
Reviews.Author: Rtraveler10570
Reviews.Content: Based on mostly good reviews, we booked our family of 6 in three rooms 6 months in advance. Noting there were one or two reviewer complaints about being shifted to another hotel, and traveling with children and an elderly gentleman needing assistance, I inquired and was promised in writing three rooms near each other. But on arrival, we were told that they had a "problem", and only had two rooms available in this location, and wanted to split up our party with one room in another hotel at some distance. This was unacceptable, so we ended up squeezing 6 into two rooms set up for four people for one night. This hotel had the nerve to charge us for three rooms for that first night, supposedly because they booked a room elsewhere. Not my problem! I received no compensation or consideration for our discomfort. Thus, my "poor" rating. In the absence of this annoyance and disappointment, I might have considered "average" to be appropriate. It was not that clean, and expanding on the infrastructure issues mentioned by others: Every visitor has to deal with some steps, starting with several up to the very small elevator (only accommodating 2 or 3 people - without bags! - 1 or 2 with bags), and a number of steps to get to breakfast, and many rooms have steps to access. Certainly not a good place for anyone with mobility problems, or if trying to push a stroller. None of the rooms in one portion of the building have telephones. Breakfast is adequate, with all drinks (including coffee) coming out of machines. As noted by others, entrance is a plain wooden door (looking like a commercial loading dock), where one must press a button to be let in each time. The upside - location is great, being only a couple blocks from the Pantheon, and only a little further to the Piazza Navona. Walking distance (if athletic) to the Coliseum/Forum area, and other central Rome features. Would I stay here again? I might consider if booking one room, but my wife certainly would not based on the poor service!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ppowers12
Reviews.Content: A sweet treat of a place close to the Pantheon (obviously cuz of the name of the hotel). But this hotel is close to a lot of the big sites. We were able to walk to Colliseum, Vatican Museum, the Spanish Steps with the greatest of ease. I liked how clean the place was and that they had a complimentary breakfast in the morning. There also is WiFi -- but it is in the lobby area. There is an elevator -- which is good cuz there are lots of steps in this place. Beds are nice and there is AC in each room. They are a bit skimpy with towels, hangers and toilet paper. But otherwise real nice.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel and would absolutely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TrinityScarf
Reviews.Content: The Pantheon Inn was such a wonderful place to stay and feel at home in Rome. It is in a brilliant central location, just a minute's walk to the Pantheon, and the hotel itself is just so charming. Within a beautiful 16th Century building, the rooms are spacious and full of Italian charm and character. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and happy to go out of their way for you. My entire stay was wonderful and easy and I would definitely stay here again when I next return to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great position for the sights and also quiet and secluded.”
Reviews.Author: Viv52
Reviews.Content: We had a double room and a room for our three older children.Both rooms were very comfortable and clean.They were tastefully decorated and had a well stocked mini-bar/fridge. Our double room was on the first floor under the breakfast room.Breakfast was nice and plentiful and totally self-service. There is a lift in the hotel and it is very secure.There was someone manning the desk at all times.They were very helpful and friendly. The location was excellent , close to the Pantheon and trattorias.It was easy to walk to the Trevi fountain and the Collosseum. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and good location”
Reviews.Author: Laurent_Thita
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only one night because we did not really plan for our trip, but we had a good time staying at Pantheon. It is located right in the middle of tourists attractions and restaurants. The hotel is charming (Italian style) and the room we stayed was the one which is close to the breakfast area, it is very cute and charming with very lovely view of Italian houses. The room is clean, cute decoration (Italian style) but you may be disturbing by the noise make by the stairs, especially when the people go for breakfast (which is normal because the hotel is cute old Italian style hotel). Moreover the staffs are friendly and we would go back there for our next trip. Also, the entrance of the hotel is a bit difficult to found, don't excepct to find a "classic" entrance, because the hotel is on the second floor of the building (there is an elevator), as many hotels in Rome. The name of the hotel is written on a golden sign which is used for the doctor or lawyer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: wualax
Reviews.Content: close to pantheon, vatican, coliseum everything is on a walking distance of 15 min or less a bit difficult to find but just check google maps and thats it very good service specially roberto give an excellent service

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: tonybob11
Reviews.Content: First time its littel dificult to find but as we book pick up service so there was not so problem for that ,but really very nice hotel with perfect location that you can go any where by walk. Staff is excelant and always ready to with cheerfull smile to give any information. Breakfast is nice,rooms are clean overall perfect hotel next time i will come in same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Roma!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MythosTime
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to Rome and we have all fallen in love with the eternal city. Stayed at The Pantheon Inn Hotel for 3 nights in a family room which we found to be clean and functional - perfect for our short stay. Towels were replenished everyday and there was a safe and mini bar. Staff were really friendly and unobtrusive. Breakfast is the only meal served at the hotel but with the abundance of cafes, bars and restaurants a short walk away this really isn't a problem. One of the things that amazed us most about the hotel was its location. The Pantheon is literally around the corner, The Trevi Fountain is a 10 minute walk away as is the Piaza Navona - a great place for a spot of people watching. The earlier you get up, the better your view point as the streets are still crowded at 10pm. Highlights = Collosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and The Vatican City. Lowlights = can't think of any! We will definitely return to Rome - we loved the sights, the people, the food, the culture. If there is one city you should visit in a lifetime it's Rome. ENJOY! PS Booked airports shuttle.com in advance to pre-book taxis to and from airport. Thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean hotel - fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: travel_novice72
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in a family room. We could not get over how great the location is - the Pantheon is literally at the end of the street and the Piazza Navona is a very short 5 minute walk away. The rooms are very clean and tidy with modern bathrooms. Staff member during the day is very helpful. Only downside, the rooms can be noisy with creaking floorboards and thin walls. Our nine year old son also found the breakfast offerings too sweet even for his sweet tooth.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: ITurner
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, staff were very friendly and breakfast was a typical 'Continental Breakfast' and of good quality. Our room was comfortable and clean, the only down side was the lack decent lighting for reading. Visitors should beware that when first arriving they are not looking for the usual hotel frontage but a plain wooden door with a buzzer alerting the staff you want to come in. Overall, an excellent hotel in a prime position. We would recommend it and will certainly use it again the next time we go to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LockwoodR
Reviews.Content: Staff were so extremely helpful and friendly in this characterful hotel in a central location perfect for a family visit in February. We could walk everywhere: Pantheon a few yards away of course, but also walked to Roman sites, St Peter's/Vatican, Trevi, Spanish Steps etc, even spotted some politicos outside Parliament! From room we could see bells of church opposite chiming. Hotel in a very quiet location - a nice surprise given previous impressions formed of Rome's traffic. We walked from Termini station on a sunny Sunday and found the hotel pretty easily. The location on Google Maps is spot on. Look for wooden double door with panel of buzzers past the Barberi outfitters to left of the Hotel Minerva. It's on upper floors but there is a lift. We stayed in Room 124 and 122 over a 3 night stay. If you want a lazy, relaxed morning then maybe 124 isn't for you as it's right under the breakfast room but was ideal for four of us - a light spacious room with windows in both bedroom and bathroom and we made early starts anyway so not troubled by upstairs noise. 122 a bigger room with beautiful ceiling, not under the breakfast room but an enclosed bathroom (although with a better shower!) as possible downside to some? Both rooms atmospheric with charming period furniture. Standard continental breakfast choice was fine, and giant prunes were amazing! Staff were all charming, smiling, friendly, gave good advice on nearby restaurants etc. Many thanks to all at the Pantheon Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Odysseu652001
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel especially for a family with kids. I had a triple room with my 12 and 15 year olds. The room was very spacious and the location just behind the Pantheon was perfect. It's a very quirky hotel--the entrance is a barely marked old gate-like double door that opens to a courtyard. The reception desk is on the second floor (accessible by elevator) and then the rooms are spread out through various floors almost like an apartment building. You really feel like you're living in Rome. Our room had clearly been updated (nice bath, nice walls), but still retained its century-old charm. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good, although the coffee could use improving (but nothing to worry about, there's an excellent coffee shop around the corner where a great capuccino costs a few euros). The internet is available only in lobby, but it's fast and free and they'll print whatever you need.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, amazing location, all round excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ch363
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an amazing location - we could see the top of the pantheon from our room. The area around the hotel is lovely- cobbled piazzas, lots of restaurants and gelaterias. The staff were very welcoming and helpful, the rooms were spacious and particularly the bathrooms were in excellent condition. We were travelling in a group of 5 friends and two 3 bed rooms suited us perfectly. All the luxuries of a hotel such as toiletries and included breakfast but not too expensive. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Marines13
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, beautiful hotel, great service. The hotel is charming and employees are professional, efficace, kind and smiling. I recommend this hotel warmly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little pricey.”
Reviews.Author: KatieL3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very centrally located and made getting to all the major sites by foot extremely easy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There are many restaurants and shops in the area. I suggest setting up a Private transfer from the airport (for a fee of course) because the hotel is tucked away and can be hard to find at first. Rooms are a little pricey, but the location makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly, welcoming and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: nrs_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the second floor, accessed by an attractive communal staircase, overlooking an internal courtyard (there is also a small lift from the ground floor landing). The room was simple, clean and quiet and the hotel felt very private for such a central location. The self-service breakfast buffet offered a good range of fresh food, pastries and hot drinks and there was plenty of it. The staff were friendly, good-natured and very helpful and we were made to feel extremely welcome, even with our 3-month old baby and all her extra demands! It was a very pleasant stay, many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, charming setting”
Reviews.Author: travelauntie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is unbeatable, with most rooms overlooking the Minerva church. It is literally 1minute away from the Pantheon with all the little lanes and restaurants around it. Locals live, shop and work in this area too, and it is nicer than the overcrowded and touristy spanish steps area. You can reach piazza navona, the forum, coliseum, vatican on foot. The hotel's entrance is through one of these giant gates you find all over, and is situated on the upper 2 floors of a grand tall 17th century buildings with a courtyard that you associate with a city like Rome. There is a lift. The rooms are spacious and modern, and the bathrooms nice, clean and well equipped. The entrance hall is small and narrow. The breakfast is sufficient but a basic buffet only.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, very kind staff, nice price.”
Reviews.Author: HDM66
Reviews.Content: The location can not be better, everything is on walking distance, max. 30-40 minutes. Staff was very kind and helpfull. The room was not very large, but we stayed there with 5 persons, so every room looks small then. We had 1 double and 3 single beds, which was perfect. Quality of the beds was also very good. Breakfast is basic but good enough , e.g. we prefer fresh coffee instead of nescafé and the juice was a little bit artificial. Over all it was a very good hotel. We would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mghys
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Pantheon Inn. The rooms are very nice and the service is impeccable. The hotel is superbly located which gives an easy access to the best spots in Rome. Nice entrance and overall atmosphere...

Reviews.Title: “They did it again!”
Reviews.Author: familyof4travelers10
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews, but didn't head the warnings. We were traveling with a large group (29) and needed rooms that accommodated families of five. We booked in April for August. A month after we all received our confirmations, the hotel sent e-mails t three families in our party stating their credit cards would not process. One family did not respond within 24hrs (responded within 48hrs.) and lost their room . Since they were a family of five and those rooms were gone they had to book two rooms in order to stay with the rest of our group. Two weeks before we were going two families got the same credit card notice, but took care of it promply. Upon arrival they had a room for everyone BUT my family. They said they had moved us to a different hotel. When we explained our frustrations, they literaaly laughed. They wanted us to walk to the new hotel to boot. I refused, so they put us in a taxi after much arguing. So 4 out of 29 people traveling together to Europe from America were separated from the group. Although we got a suite in the new hotel, neither hotel was anything to speak. We paid the same rate as we had booked, but our new hotel did not accept credit cards so we had to pay cash. Never again! Please head the warnings

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, staff and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TaraDCharleston
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is extraordinary and the staff was professional, helpful and welcoming. The hotel is just around the corner from the bustle of the Pantheon and we enjoyed slipping into the building that felt more like a home than an Inn. We loved this hotel and will definitely visit on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, cosy and clean little hidden hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmor56
Reviews.Content: No luxury, but a gift to those who wan't good service, a cosy clean room and a perfect location in the middle of Rome and yet very silent. Breakfast though could be better. Don't be worried about the street entrance, when you reach the second floor you enter the hotel and will be met by smiling and serviceminded staff.

Reviews.Title: “After a lot of research we chose the Inn...”
Reviews.Author: Taivassalo
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research we chose the Inn because of its location. However, this beautiful Inn has a lot more to offer than just being steps from the Pantheon and minutes from almost every other major atraction in Rome. The people who work at the Pantheon are great and the 2 gentlemen running the front desk are so helpful and polite, the really made me and my entire family feel so welcome (3 and 5 year old children). I would not hesitate recommending this place to anyone and already look forward to our next stay and we haven't even left yet! Thanks for helping make a lifetime of memories come true.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem allowing comfortable access to the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: chrish42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pantheon Inn with our two young children and enjoyed attentive service, comfortable and clean room and nice breakfast. The hotel has bundles of character and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ftrips
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, offering good value bed and breakfast in an excellent location. Friendly and helpfull staff. Clean, pleasant rooms with modern bathroom. Good continental breakfast. Would definately use again. Perfect base for sightseeing with a family.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford to, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Familyinsydney
Reviews.Content: After having read so many great reviews of this hotel we were disappointed overall although the location is great. We booked a 'suite' for family with teenagers and emailed beforehand to confirm that everyone would have a 'proper' bed. We were assured that it had two kingsized beds whereas in actual fact one was a very uncomfortable lumpy sofa bed. The shower leaked onto the bedroom floor and our room wasn't made up on either day of our stay. Having the room by the lobby means there is constant noise from the front door opening & closing particularly at night. We also didn't find out about the lift til we checked out (they assumed we liked carrying 3 cases up 3 flights of stairs). Breakfast just horribly basic, stale cereal, disgusting hot drinks machine n juice in plastic disposable cups. Not an attractive place to return to after long hot sightseeing days and defintely not somewhere we'll be going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in very nice location”
Reviews.Author: ksakseid
Reviews.Content: From street level, the only sign of the hotel is actually the rather small sign with the name "Pantheon Inn". We spent several minutes finding the entrance - the hotel is actually located in the 3rd floor, with entrance from the back yarden. You would never know there was a hotel there, if you weren't looking for it :-) We stayed there for 2 nights (2 adults and 6 teen-agers) sharing 4 rooms. We really enjoyed this hotel. It's just behind the Pantheon and Piazza della Rotonda, less than a minute walking from one of the most famous places in Rome - but in a rather quiet street not so crowded by tourists. The breakfast was all right - maybe not to be compared with what you get in a large business hotel - but actually better than expected, based on experiences from similar hotels in Rome. The rooms were nice and clean, air-condition working ok - it was quite hot outside! We had a room with a balcony with green plants and flowers. Probably the most romantic room in the hotel - with entrance directly from the breakfast room :-) The hotel is almost a small labyrint of small stairs and hallways (the building can not possibly have been designed for this purpose) - with a tiny tiny reception where you meet the charming and friendly hotel staff. They speak English very well, and they were also very helpful when we ordered pick-up service in advance - answering e-mails quickly If you are looking for a typical mainstream hotel with all facilities organized in the way exactly as you are used to - then try somewhere else. But if you are looking for a charming place, with an atmosphere, in the heart of Rome - then try this !! We will certainly come back Janne & Kjetil Norway

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: KarenJ22
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Pantheon Inn was wonderful. The staff was excellent, friendly and helpful. The location was perfect allowing us to walk everywhere we wanted and catch public transportation too. We would definitely recommend the Pantheon Inn.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel on very good location!”
Reviews.Author: ivanavs
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just restructured, so we got great, clean rooms. Location near Panthen is excellent and the staff was very friendly. I really recommend this hotel as very good value for money! Ivana Visek, Croatia

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, friendly staff, quite the hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: nomad_at_heart60745
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not have been better. It is about 100 ft from the Pantheon, within walking distance to both the Forum and Vatican. I spent three nights there by myself (single girl traveling solo) and felt completely safe. Continental breakfast and (surprisingly fast) internet connection are complimentary. The setting of the hotel is somewhat unconventional - it occupies two floors of an old residential building with a cute courtyard. I stayed in their suite and it has big windows and a balcony overlooking the courtyard. Beautiful room.

Reviews.Title: “strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: claude51paris
Reviews.Content: Great location , next to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The place is difficult to find ( from the street ,no hotel entrance or signs!)...BUT once you find the bell and the door opens, the second and third floor of this ancient building is a real palace with nice rooms and excellent service. Breakfast is great and rooms are very clean. We will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “If money is a big issue and you're...”
Reviews.Author: RickChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: If money is a big issue and you're looking for a well-situated location for Rome, this is an ok choice. Rooms were clean but not nice. Beds weren't comfortable and the breakfast was bad. Now I know why it was substantally cheaper than everywhere else for a party of 4. If you're looking for somewhere nice on vacation, pass on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: D_Nicole85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely hard to find, but once we did we realized what a gem of a location it was! That was basically the only good thing to come out of the hotel. The staff member who checked us in was very friendly, however the night/morning staff who checked us out was extremely rude. We were told there would be a breakfast buffet, there was none. We had to drop off our key each time we left the hotel which we felt was unsettling, so we all carried our money and passports with us. They were also supposed to call us a taxi to the airport and forgot to do so! The room was decent for the price and location. Good for a short stay, but would not recommend for anything longer than 2 days!

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff, location couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: mfamilie
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a nice place in rome to stay for a few days, the pantheon inn is exactly what you are looking for. located in one of the best quarters of the city, this hotel is the ideal starting point for a day's trip around rome or a night out on the town. you can reach all of the main sights conveniently by foot within an acceptable time span. the pantheon inn is a very charming small hotel that offers its guests a nice little breakfast in an attractive surrounding. in addition to the staff being very friendly and forthcoming, the hotel arranged a pick-up for us from rome's fiumicino airport and back at our favor. It's located on the 2nd floor without an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “This littel Hotel is centricity,well priced and the Service is very good”
Reviews.Author: Pantheon_Rom
Reviews.Content: We were happy to find this nice littel Hotel with breakfirst near the Pantheon.Our room have had a littel balcony with a beautiful view of roofgardens The place is so central that you can reach every object of interest by foot. We bought a Rom Pass valid for three days, because the entry for the first two Museum is free and besides the local traffic is free too.

Reviews.Title: “Pantheon Inn is woth a look if you want a well located safe environment”
Reviews.Author: Westernboy
Reviews.Content: The Pantheon Inn is located about 75 meters from the back of the Pantheon. This makes it well located for walking to the Tevi Fountain, Colosseum, Forum, Spanish Steps, Piazza Venezia and the Vatican. The rooms are basic by any North American standard but they are clean, the water is hot and the maid service excellent. Do not let the exterior door fool you. The hotel (7 rooms) is located on the 3rd floor of an ancient building, the lift is cute and everything is "compact". The breakfast really hits the spot and is adequate for most appetites. The staff members are wonderfully attentive, always willing to provide information about the sites, prices, cautions etc in Rome. The rooms on the front enjoy a typical Roman street and its associated activities, the rear rooms have a view of an adjacent courtyard. Across the street is an internet point, beside that is a drug store and all around are restaurants and bars. For the best prices on almost everything visit the "supermarceto" which is located to the right of the Pantheon (when facing the Pantheon) about 8 doors to the left of the McDonalds Restaurant (when facing the McDonald's Restaurant). Your visit to Rome will be enhanced by a visit to The Pantheon Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in the best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: liz1564
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pantheon Inn for 11 days. It is opposite St. Maria sopra Minerva and around the corner from the Pantheon. We could not have been treated better. The staff are wonderful and very helpful. Roberto and Veeru are able to answer any question about Rome, including how to use the busses to get to the most out-of-the-way places. (For example, the Number 116 bus literally stops at the doors of the hotel and takes you right to the Borghese Gardens. And it is a neat ride on the little electric bus!) Another plus is that our room was quiet. At night the only sounds were the pigeons. No garbage trucks at 5AM; no motorcycles; no revelers at midnight. . Here is a hint. The hotel is really hard to locate. If we hadn't taken a taxi we would probably still be looking for the entrance. The Pantheon Inn is located behind a large weathered green door. The door is between a jewelry shop and a shop that sells priests' vestments. You have to ring the doorbell to the left of the door and be buzzed in. (Pantheon Inn is the first button).. When you are inside the courtyard, walk up the few steps on the left. You will see the elevator in an small alcove on the right. Press number 2 to get to the Pantheon Inn. Hearty souls can walk up the steps to the second floor (third floor for Americans) but it is a long haul with luggage. If you want Roman charm, stay at the Pantheon Inn. Elaine C.

Reviews.Title: “I would love to come again”
Reviews.Author: cityhopper2010
Reviews.Content: I would come here again on my next trip to Rome. Staying at Pantheon Inn made our trip a great trip. The location is perfect, we never even had to use public transport. One of the 4 beds wasn't good, but after telling the staff, they organized a good 4th bed, so the service was great. Homey atmosphere. Breakfast was with simple products, but enough variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: johnm999
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent - very close to the Pantheon & Trevi Fountain and all other important sites within comfortable walking distance. Desk staff very friendly & helpful. Rooms clean and towels changed daily. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , Great location.”
Reviews.Author: CorkColin
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and courteous staff . The Room was a triple and was a very good size. Would be great if there was a sign for the lift more clearly marked on the wall as you pass , as I missed it and had to climb the 3 flights of steps with 2 cases. The location was ideal , very close to all sights , ( just around the corner from the Pantheon & close to cafes etc. Clean,Central a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pantheon Inn was like a second house for us !”
Reviews.Author: lovely_lily2
Reviews.Content: We liked very much this hotel and the service was excellent, three men so nice and so friendly ! We realy loved our stay in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay that I would recommend to anyone who wants a great central location in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: brandy96
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Pantheon enthusiastically! Every part of our stay there was fantastic. Every member of the staff was so very helpful, positive and welcoming. They were ready to help with every question that we had about how to maximize our stay in Rome. The breakfast was good and there was a very pleasant breakfast room. The rooms had all of the necessary amenities and my husband and I were lucky enough to have the room with a balcony on which we enjoyed breakfast and a before-dinner drink. Everything was very very clean. The hotel has lots of charm and makes you feel as if you are truly living in the city and not in an antiseptic "American" environment. The location of the Pantheon Inn is excellent and if for no other reason, this would be a major reason for me to stay there again. When you are looking for the hotel you need to look for a charming old, large green door. It is very rustic looking but those who are seasoned travelers will realize the beauty of the door and its historic value. The price for the location of the inn is a plus as well. We were traveling with two other couples and their rooms were equally comfortable. We all enjoyed our stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: Vickiehome
Reviews.Content: The historic Garibaldi house converted into a wonderful B&B is in the perfect location for a visit to Rome. We stayed 4 nights with friends and all loved the warmth, service, location, and hospitality of Roberto, Veeru, Santanu and Roberta, the hotel staff. We could walk with in 20-25 minutes to the Vatican and within minutes to Piazza Navonna, the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. Within that area we found many great places to eat. Roberto offered us help with directions and tours, and arranged for our transfers from the port of Civitecchia and to the airport for an early flight home. The historic entrance door just added to the ambience and charm of this great B&B. Roberta always had fresh breakfast rolls, coffee cake, ham, cheese, salami and fruit cocktail ready for us for a true Italian breakfast. Cereal, yogurt, juice and coffee were also provided. Would definitely return for our next Rome visit.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: SAELLARUNGAR
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights over the weekend, good value for money, will definitely come again. Very central location, charming old rooms, friendly staff, clean, reasonably good breakfast (by Italian standards).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GeirH
Reviews.Content: The entrance to the hotel might put you on alert you. But once you have opened the odd door you find a wonderful place to stay for your holiday in Rome. The hospitality is great, the rooms are very good and the location is excellent. We stayed with 2 kids in a family-room for 4 nights and had nothing to complain about. Pantheon Inn gave us the perfect starting point for every day of our vacation in Rome. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “A place to come back to”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaUtrecht
Reviews.Content: The most hotels in the world are more or less the same. Pantheon Inn gives in a special caracteristic way ithe feeling to be in Rome, even when you are inside the building. It made our 6 days stay together with the use of bicycles and the wondrfull weather to an unforgettable event. Just the breakfast needs upgrading. During our stay it was quite monotonous. The possibillity of ordering an egg or some fresh fruitjuice is in that way enough. Otto Nelemans, the Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Charming and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Stiane
Reviews.Content: Very charming and Roman style hotel, at the best location ever. Staff was execent, very sweet and helpful. The only minus was that we had some problems with the hot/cold water the first 2 days, but the staff where doing all they could to fix the problems. Please note that though the rooms are very cosy, they are extremely small if you are 3 people as we where, it was more like a room for maximum 2 people. And the breakfast was not worth eating, especially the coffee, which came from a machine, not fresh as you would expect in the land of coffee. Luckily there where so many nice places for coffee around the hotel. Though these few things, which I am sorry to write, it was a very pleasant stay, and a wonderful atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: taa11
Reviews.Content: Our troubles started with trying to find the location of Pantheon Inn. We made at least 3 phone calls to the hotel to find out exact location and their suggestion where to park the car. Not much help was provided, but nothing sounded alarming at that point. One hour later we finally found a parking spot and found that hotel ( no signs downstairs, no indication whatsoever - hotel is apparently just a floor in a regularly looking building) . 4 flights up (no elevator) ... needless to say that we were exhausted and were dreaming to get to bed... "Not that fast!"... Pantheon was apparently overbooked and couldn’t accommodate us despite actually charging our credit card for prepayment (over $300). We were told that we have to go to some cheap hotel near to train station (who knows Rome can tell the difference in location). No excuses, no applogies, instead we got very rude receptionist and angry manager (or owner) who refused to issue the refund to us or provide the letter that the hotel is in fact overbooked and can't accomodate us at their location. Nasty scene in the lobby! Just terrible experience - one of the worse in my busy traveling life - I never ever had anything even close to this .... No explanation was given why they didn't tell us over the phone that they have no room ...P.S. thank God we didn't bring our luggage upstairs ( remeber, it is high 4 stories up - no elevator).

Reviews.Title: “This Pensione was PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: FLDoyle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights last week. I'll start with the staff....Roberto and Veeru are just so nice, kind and helpful. I happened to mention to them in an email while booking that we were celebrating our 15 year anniversary and they gave us the room with a balcony and also delivered a bottle of champagne to us upon arrival...did not charge us for it. They helped with all questions we had, spoke great English. Then, we came back to the city at the end of our trip and had the day to spend in Rome before we had to catch a flight back and they allowed us to park our luggage there all day while we toured around and even called and arranged a driver to take us back to the airport, which I thought was a kind, extra service. The rooms were clean and everything else seemed fine although we did not partake of the breakfast as we wanted to be out and experience several different cafe's in the area. I will definitely return to this little B&B again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: RonCCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay at the Pantheon Inn in Rome for July 26 thur 20th 2009 with 5 other couples. Upon arriving at the hotel and dragging our luggage up 4 flights of stairs since the elevator was broke, (yes the hotel lobby is on the 4th floor, somthing they fail to mention upfront) we were informed that the was only room for 4 couples of the 6 and the other 2 couples would have to stay in another hotel of their choosing. I said this was unacceptable since we were traveling as a group and I went to the hotel Abergo Santa Chiara a block away. (very nice) The desk clerk then informed me I would have to pay for the first night, even though they didn't have a room for me. Since my return, my credit card has been billed for all 4 nights, which I have disputed. I have tried to contact the hotel but they do not respond. Neither does the web site I booked it through, Easytobook.com I have sent them numerous emails and all I get back is that they are out of the office, even though I sent the emails during their stated office hours. Not only is this hotel a dive, they are CROOKS

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: honeyandwolfe
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the our stay at the Pantheon Inn very much. It is centrally located, but is a little difficult to locate because the sign is so small. One can pass by it without notice. Once inside the staff is friendly, and the rooms were clean. The only drawback for us was that the air conditioning was a little weak for July temperatures. The breakfast was excellent. If you are going to book a room, let me give you directions that will save you a litlte trouble finding it. If you face the Pantheon from the front, you should take the road to the left of the building. After passing the Pantheon take the first left that you come to. It will be around fifty to seventy yards down the street on the right. The only indication of its existence is a small brass plaque on the building beside the two big green doors. You then must be buzzed into the buiding. Just push the button on the wall beside the Pantheon Inn button and you will be buzzed in. It was worth the effort to find it!

Reviews.Title: “Beware!! Hotel cancelled our reservation without notice!!”
Reviews.Author: LFZ23
Reviews.Content: After having seen reviews of this place where the hotel had cancelled existing reservations, we were uneasy about reserving here. Nevertheless, because we love the hotel's location and could not find rooms at a couple of other hotels in close proximity, we decided to reserve at the Pantheon Inn but we were very careful to verify and confirm our reservations by email with the hotel several times. We had no less than 5 separate email communications with the hotel over a 3+ week period verifying our reservations (and confirming our airport pickup), including one the day before we arrived. Needless to say, when we arrived at the airport in Rome the driver was not there to pick us up. After calling the hotel, we were told the driver was at the wrong location (eventually a driver picked us up). Once in the car to the hotel, the driver told us we were being taken to a different hotel in a completely different area of the city! We again called the hotel and were informed that the hotel was booked and they did not have a room for us!!! It appears that this is a common practice for these people. It is horribly unfair and inconvenient. We cannot urge you to STAY AWAY FROM THESE LIARS in any stronger terms.

Reviews.Title: “perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMP
Reviews.Content: husband booked this as a surprise visit, so was curious of accomodation on arrival, the location was perfect, central to most major sites and restaurants. The Inn was small but very freindly, the staff were very cheerful and helpful, the Inn was clean and had everything you need for a short stay, breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Don't book this hotel! Will take your money!”
Reviews.Author: bloodytourist
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I did not get a chance to stay at this hotel. The story goes as follows: Me and my girlfriend booked a four nights stay in the beginning of April this year via hotels.com. I even made arrangements via email personally, and everything seemed fine. Until the morning after the cancelation deadline set by Hotels.com: At 7.41am (the deadline was midnight, 7,41 hours before the mail was sent) The hotel sent me an email stating that because of maintenance work taking place, they did not have a room for us, but no problem, they would like to offer us a room at their sister hotel. The trouble was that the sister hotel was in a different part of town, a part that we did not like to stay in. I politely declined the offer and canceled our booking directly with Pantheon Inn via email. Since it was less than 48 hours before our flight to Rome, I promptly booked another hotel of my own, naturally thinking that Pantheon Inn would accept my cancellation. Not so. They fairly quickly rang me and said they had a room after all! I had to tell them that I had canceled via email and that we had to book another hotel, without the possibility to cancel the new reservation. They then said I had to cancel via Hotels.com, something that was anything but straight forward, as we were past the cancellation deadline. Finally I got a cancellation confirmation from Hotels.com, but as this confirmation was not in place until the day before our arrival at Pantheon Inn, the Pantheon Inn chose to fully charge my credit card for the whole stay! I clearly did not accept this and expressed this clearly to the hotel directly via email, and also to Hotels.com, which I must say has been exceptional in their service trying to get Pantheon Inn to listen to reason. Not so, after a month of pestering Hotels.com, and in their turn Venere.com, all that Pantheon Inn could offer was a free 3 day stay at a later opportunity. Trouble is that we will never stay at this hotel, even for "free"! We have fortunatly found our hotel in Rome. It's close by and called the "Albergo del Sole Al Pantheon". An excellent, but slightly pricy, hotel right beside the Pantheon. The holiday turned out to be excellent, despite the crooks at Pantheon Inn.

Reviews.Title: “The best for a location”
Reviews.Author: File101
Reviews.Content: Pantheon Inn is middle of all main sights, very delightful for its location and atmosphere. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: ProudHerts
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel off the internet and as always you can never be to sure whether places will live up to expectations. I am happy to say that our experience, myself & my husband, with The Pantheon Inn was a pleasure. As they offered a service of arranging a car to collect us from the airport i emailed the Pantheon Inn to ask them to arrange this and confirm the price. I received an email by return with confirmation that this had been actioned and the cost in euro's. As promised upon arrival in Rome our car was waiting for us and after a 40 minute drive into Rome we arrived at the Pantheon Inn. Behind a very understated green, large set of wooden doors, which led us up 2 flights of stairs we entered the entrance to the Pantheon Inn. With a warm welcome, Roberto showed us to our room. We had been lucky enough to have the room with the balcony. The room was very comfortable, clean & bright, with an en-suite bathroom (shower only no bath). Our room was right next to the breakfast room, in the mornings you can hear the creaking of the stairs as fellow holiday makers made their way to breakfast past your door. This by no means caused us any problems and was a great alarm clock for us to consider doing the same. The breakfast room was very welcoming, with tables set ready for you for breakfast. It was a self service basis, with an offering of pastries, cake, bread rolls, cheese, ham, coffee etc... I was celebrating my birthday during our visit and to my surprise they left a bottle of wine & 2 glasses in our room on my birthday, i was really touched and was impressed by their personal touch. Roberto and his team made us feel very welcome, providing us with a map and local information. The reception was manned 24 hours a day and they were always very willing to provide any assistance you may need or just pass the time of day. Location was perfect, just a 5 minute walk to The Pantheon and a 10 minute walk to the Piazza Navona we felt that we could not have picked a better location. This was our first visit to Rome & The Pantheon Inn helped to make this visit special. When we visit Rome again i will be booking my stay at The Pantheon Inn again.

HotelInfo.Name: Pantheon Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Via Santa Caterina da Siena 57, 00187 Rome, Italy
